title: [K-12] Curriculum Improvement Program Applying Learner-Centered PLHET Model for Integrated Medicine-Society Education: Strengthening Civic Health Competencies

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational knowledge in basic medicine and anatomy, basic understanding of community health issues (including historical, geographical, and economic factors), experience in citizen engagement projects
context.additional_context: A BYOD classroom enabling team-based learning, with customized activities designed according to Kolb’s learning styles, linked to citizen participation projects for community health promotion (collaborating with local institutions, considering cultural sensitivity).

learning_goals: Learners can propose citizen health promotion strategies by applying PLHET model-based integrated medical-social content to real clinical and community contexts.

Learners will collaboratively understand complex medical concepts and social contexts (history, culture, systems) through activities tailored to Kolb’s 4 learning styles (assimilating, diverging, converging, accommodating).

In a 4-week team-based problem-solving activity (theme: resolving community health disparities), learners will write self-directed learning plans weekly (2 learning goals, 3 methods, 1 evaluation criterion), present 3+ creative solutions in the final team presentation, and achieve an average of 4+/5 on the peer evaluation rubric.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
